required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study of Sildenafil in Neonates and Preterm Infants

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of dopamine which is used as treatment of hypotension in neonate and preterm infant.

primary_outcome.measure: Steady state concentration of dopamine (Css) at 2mcg/kg/min
primary_outcome.time_frame: After continuous infusion for more than 30 minutes at 2mcg/kg/min

primary_outcome.measure: Steady state concentration of dopamine (Css) at 5mcg/kg/min
primary_outcome.time_frame: After continuous infusion for more than 30 minutes at 5mcg/kg/min

primary_outcome.time_frame: After continuous infusion for more than 30 minutes at 15mcg/kg/min

primary_outcome.time_frame: After continuous infusion for more than 30 minutes at 20mcg/kg/min

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted at NICU in Seoul National University Hospital, Seoul Asan Hospital or Severance Hospital
- Infants who were diagnosed with hypotension
Exclusion Criteria:
- Congenital heart disease
- Chromosomal anomaly
- Treated with ECMO or CRRT
- Arrhythmia
- Hypovolemic state
